info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:35PM EDT until July 29 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...CENTRAL GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRICO... WEST CENTRAL HANOVER AND NORTH CENTRAL POWHATAN COUNTIES... At 135 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oilville, or 7 miles northeast of Goochland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Montpelier around 145 PM EDT. Tuckahoe and Wyndham around 150 PM EDT. Laurel around 200 PM EDT. Ashland, Randolph Macon College and Glen Allen around 205 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Orchid, Crozier, Sandy Hook, Vontay, Maidens, Gum Tree, Three Square, Irwin, Johnsons Springs and Goodall. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
